This retention dynamic is a direct generalization of the two-group case. Next, we show the retention of group ps(t+1)subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘¡1ğ‘ p^{(t+1)}_{s}italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at time t+1ğ‘¡1t+1italic_t + 1 is shown as Eqn.Â (13), resulting in the new data distribution D(t+1)superscriptğ·ğ‘¡1D^{(t+1)}italic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

ps(t+1):=â„›â¢(s,t)âˆ‘sâ€²âˆˆ{a,b}â„›â¢(s,t)assignsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘¡1ğ‘ â„›ğ‘ ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘ğ‘â„›ğ‘ ğ‘¡p^{(t+1)}_{s}:=\frac{\mathcal{R}(s,t)}{\sum_{s^{\prime}\in\{a,b\}}\mathcal{R}(% s,t)}italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := divide start_ARG caligraphic_R ( italic_s , italic_t ) end_ARG start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ { italic_a , italic_b } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R ( italic_s , italic_t ) end_ARG (13)

We perform the mean estimation task for the whole data distribution with both RERM and Fair-RERM using the linear regression model. For Fair-RERM, we use RERM, Fair-RERM-RW and Fair-RERM to perform 30303030 rounds of risk minimization where the loss is mean squared error (MSE), and name them as Fair-RERM-GLP (group-level penalty), Fair-RERM-SLP (sample-level penalty) and Fair-RERM-RW (reweighting). We first verify the convergence of performative loss of the above methods in Fig. 7 where all Fair-RERM methods have Ï=0.1ğœŒ0.1\rho=0.1italic_Ï = 0.1. The results demonstrate all methods successfully converge to the PS point.

Next, we verify the effectiveness of Fair-RERM by visualizing the dynamics of performative loss disparity between the groups while varying ÏğœŒ\rhoitalic_Ï in Fig. 8, where the higher ÏğœŒ\rhoitalic_Ï still results in lower loss disparity at the stable point, revealing that Fair-RERM-RW and Fair-RERM are effective.

C.3 Performative Gaussian data classification.

We use a synthetic dataset consisting of 1000100010001000 samples from 2 demographic groups sâˆˆ{a,b}ğ‘ ğ‘ğ‘s\in\{a,b\}italic_s âˆˆ { italic_a , italic_b } with features X={X1,X2}ğ‘‹subscriptğ‘‹1subscriptğ‘‹2X=\{X_{1},X_{2}\}italic_X = { italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } and labels Yâˆˆ{0,1}ğ‘Œ01Y\in\{0,1\}italic_Y âˆˆ { 0 , 1 }. For group ağ‘aitalic_a, Y=ğŸ™â¢{x1âˆ’0.5â¢x2â‰¥0.5}ğ‘Œ1subscriptğ‘¥10.5subscriptğ‘¥20.5Y=\mathbbm{1}\{x_{1}-0.5x_{2}\geq 0.5\}italic_Y = blackboard_1 { italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 0.5 italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0.5 }. For group bğ‘bitalic_b, Y=ğŸ™â¢{0.5â¢x1+0.5â¢x2â‰¥0.5}ğ‘Œ10.5subscriptğ‘¥10.5subscriptğ‘¥20.5Y=\mathbbm{1}\{0.5x_{1}+0.5x_{2}\geq 0.5\}italic_Y = blackboard_1 { 0.5 italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 0.5 italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0.5 }. The initial group fraction and the retention mapping are the same as in the previous experiment. Using a logistic classification model for risk minimization, we first verify the convergence of performative loss in Fig. 9 and the effectiveness of Fair-RERM-RW and Fair-RERM in Fig.13(a) and Fig. 13(b). All plots demonstrate the same trends as the previous experiment.

C.4 Gaussian Mean Estimation Using Group Loss Variance

In Example 4.2, we already prove that group loss variance as a fair penalty term violates the strong convexity assumption. In this section, we show its unconvergence while performing the Gaussian mean estimation task under the same setting mentioned in Section 6 when Ï=0.5ğœŒ0.5\rho=0.5italic_Ï = 0.5. The dynamics of â€–Î¸tâˆ’Î¸tâˆ’1â€–normsubscriptğœƒğ‘¡subscriptğœƒğ‘¡1\|\theta_{t}-\theta_{t-1}\|âˆ¥ italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ as well as performative loss are shown as follows. Fig. 11 shows the unconvergence, which is contradicted to Fig. 12(a) where we show the convergence of Fair-RERM.

C.5 K-delayed RERM on Credit Data

We examine the effectiveness of k-delayed RERM schema on Credit Data [23] which is the same dataset used by Brown etÂ al. [5]. Specifically, we use k=3ğ‘˜3k=3italic_k = 3 and Ïµ=1italic-Ïµ1\epsilon=1italic_Ïµ = 1 to form equal-sized agent groups uniformly in the whole population to let each subgroup best respond with different speed (Example 1 in Brown etÂ al. [5]). We also let the retention dynamic be k-delayed, adding additional challenges compared to the previous work. We examine Ïâˆˆ{0.3,0.7}ğœŒ0.30.7\rho\in\{0.3,0.7\}italic_Ï âˆˆ { 0.3 , 0.7 } while all other settings are the same as the Credit Data experiment in Section 6.

Then we first verify the convergence of performative loss in Fig. 9 and the effectiveness of k-delayed Fair-RERM-RW and Fair-RERM in Fig.13(a) and Fig. 13(b). All plots demonstrate the same trends as the previous experiment with RRM schema.

Appendix D Proofs for the Theoretical Results

D.1 Proof of Proposition 5.1

We will first present lemmas for this proposition.

Lemma D.1.

(First order optimality condition of convex functions [41]).

If fğ‘“fitalic_f is convex and Î©Î©\Omegaroman_Î© is a closed convex set on which fğ‘“fitalic_f is differentiable, then

xâˆ—âˆˆargâ¡minxâˆˆÎ©â¡fâ¢(x),superscriptğ‘¥subscriptğ‘¥Î©ğ‘“ğ‘¥x^{*}\in\arg\min_{x\in\Omega}f(x),italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x âˆˆ roman_Î© end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ) , (14)

if and only if (yâˆ’xâˆ—)âŠ¤â¢âˆ‡gâ¢(xâˆ—)â‰¥0superscriptğ‘¦superscriptğ‘¥topâˆ‡ğ‘”superscriptğ‘¥0(y-x^{*})^{\top}\nabla g(x^{*})\geq 0( italic_y - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‡ italic_g ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) â‰¥ 0 for all yâˆˆÎ©ğ‘¦Î©y\in\Omegaitalic_y âˆˆ roman_Î©.

Lemma D.2.

(â„’fairsubscriptâ„’fair\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT under fair penalty mechanisms is Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strongly convex)

Under the conditions in Lemma 2.4, the loss aware objective â„’fairsubscriptâ„’fair\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in Eqn (7) and (8) are Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strongly convex.

Proof.

We will show this for the sample level fair penalty Eqn (8) first.

From conditions in Lemma 2.4, we know that â„“â„“\ellroman_â„“ is Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strongly convex, and by definition â„“â‰¥0â„“0\ell\geq 0roman_â„“ â‰¥ 0, we will show that â„“2â¢(ğœ½;Z)superscriptâ„“2ğœ½ğ‘\ell^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta};Z)roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; italic_Z ) is also convex in ğœ½ğœ½\boldsymbol{\theta}bold_italic_Î¸. For simplicity of notation, we will derive for an arbitrary fixed Zğ‘Zitalic_Z and omit Zğ‘Zitalic_Z in the following derivation and use â„“â¢(ğœ½)â„“ğœ½\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta})roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ ).

From the definition of convexity, we have âˆ€Î±âˆˆ(0,1),âˆ€ğœ½1,ğœ½2âˆˆÎ˜formulae-sequencefor-allğ›¼01for-allsubscriptğœ½1subscriptğœ½2Î˜\forall\alpha\in(0,1),\forall\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1},\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2}\in\Thetaâˆ€ italic_Î± âˆˆ ( 0 , 1 ) , âˆ€ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ roman_Î˜,

â„“â¢((1âˆ’Î±)â¢ğœ½1+Î±â¢ğœ½2)â‰¤(1âˆ’Î±)â¢â„“â¢(ğœ½1)+Î±â¢â„“â¢(ğœ½2).â„“1ğ›¼subscriptğœ½1ğ›¼subscriptğœ½21ğ›¼â„“subscriptğœ½1ğ›¼â„“subscriptğœ½2\ell((1-\alpha)\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1}+\alpha\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2})\leq(1-% \alpha)\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1})+\alpha\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2}).roman_â„“ ( ( 1 - italic_Î± ) bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_Î± bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ ( 1 - italic_Î± ) roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Î± roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (15)

Squaring both sides in the above gives us

â„“2â¢((1âˆ’Î±)â¢ğœ½1+Î±â¢ğœ½2)â‰¤superscriptâ„“21ğ›¼subscriptğœ½1ğ›¼subscriptğœ½2absent\displaystyle\ell^{2}((1-\alpha)\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1}+\alpha\boldsymbol{% \theta}_{2})\leqroman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( 1 - italic_Î± ) bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_Î± bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ (1âˆ’Î±)2â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½1)+Î±2â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½2)+2â¢Î±â¢(1âˆ’Î±)â¢â„“â¢(ğœ½1)â¢â„“â¢(ğœ½2)superscript1ğ›¼2superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½1superscriptğ›¼2superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½22ğ›¼1ğ›¼â„“subscriptğœ½1â„“subscriptğœ½2\displaystyle~{}(1-\alpha)^{2}\ell^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1})+\alpha^{2}\ell% ^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2})+2\alpha(1-\alpha)\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1})% \ell(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2})( 1 - italic_Î± ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Î± start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + 2 italic_Î± ( 1 - italic_Î± ) roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (16)
=\displaystyle== (1âˆ’Î±)2â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½1)+Î±2â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½2)+2â¢Î±â¢(1âˆ’Î±)â¢â„“â¢(ğœ½1)â¢â„“â¢(ğœ½2)superscript1ğ›¼2superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½1superscriptğ›¼2superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½22ğ›¼1ğ›¼â„“subscriptğœ½1â„“subscriptğœ½2\displaystyle~{}(1-\alpha)^{2}\ell^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1})+\alpha^{2}\ell% ^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2})+2\alpha(1-\alpha)\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1})% \ell(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2})( 1 - italic_Î± ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Î± start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + 2 italic_Î± ( 1 - italic_Î± ) roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
âˆ’(1âˆ’Î±)â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½1)âˆ’Î±â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½2)+(1âˆ’Î±)â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½1)+Î±â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½2)1ğ›¼superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½1ğ›¼superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½21ğ›¼superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½1ğ›¼superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½2\displaystyle~{}-(1-\alpha)\ell^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1})-\alpha\ell^{2}(% \boldsymbol{\theta}_{2})+(1-\alpha)\ell^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1})+\alpha% \ell^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2})- ( 1 - italic_Î± ) roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_Î± roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ( 1 - italic_Î± ) roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Î± roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
=\displaystyle== âˆ’Î±â¢(1âˆ’Î±)â¢[â„“â¢(ğœ½1)âˆ’â„“2â¢(ğœ½1)]2+(1âˆ’Î±)â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½1)+Î±â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½2)ğ›¼1ğ›¼superscriptdelimited-[]â„“subscriptğœ½1superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½121ğ›¼superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½1ğ›¼superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½2\displaystyle~{}-\alpha(1-\alpha)[\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1})-\ell^{2}(% \boldsymbol{\theta}_{1})]^{2}+(1-\alpha)\ell^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1})+% \alpha\ell^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2})- italic_Î± ( 1 - italic_Î± ) [ roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( 1 - italic_Î± ) roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Î± roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
â‰¤\displaystyle\leqâ‰¤ (1âˆ’Î±)â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½1)+Î±â¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½2),1ğ›¼superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½1ğ›¼superscriptâ„“2subscriptğœ½2\displaystyle~{}(1-\alpha)\ell^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1})+\alpha\ell^{2}(% \boldsymbol{\theta}_{2}),( 1 - italic_Î± ) roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Î± roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

which shows the convexity of â„“2superscriptâ„“2\ell^{2}roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Therefore, â„“â¢(ğœ½)+Ïâ¢â„“2â¢(ğœ½)â„“ğœ½ğœŒsuperscriptâ„“2ğœ½\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta})+\rho\ell^{2}(\boldsymbol{\theta})roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ ) + italic_Ï roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ) is a sum of a Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strongly convex function and a convex function and thus is Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strongly convex. Then since â„’fairsubscriptâ„’fair\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an affine combination of Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strongly convex functions, it is also Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strongly convex.

For Eqn (7), since â„’ssubscriptâ„’ğ‘ \mathcal{L}_{s}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strongly convex for âˆ€sfor-allğ‘ \forall sâˆ€ italic_s, we can similarly show â„’fairsubscriptâ„’fair\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strongly convex. âˆ

Lemma D.3.

(â„’fairsubscriptâ„’fair\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT under fair penalty mechanisms is Î²~~ğ›½\tilde{\beta}over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG-jointly smooth)

Under conditions in Lemma 2.4, the loss aware objective â„’fairsubscriptâ„’fair\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in Eqn (7) and (8) are Î²~~ğ›½\tilde{\beta}over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG-jointly smooth, where Î²~=(2â¢Ïâ¢â„“Â¯+1)â¢Î²~ğ›½2ğœŒÂ¯â„“1ğ›½\tilde{\beta}=(2\rho\overline{\ell}+1)\betaover~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG = ( 2 italic_Ï overÂ¯ start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG + 1 ) italic_Î².

Proof.

Denote g:=â„“2assignğ‘”superscriptâ„“2g:=\ell^{2}italic_g := roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, then we have âˆ‡ğœ½g=2â¢â„“â‹…âˆ‡ğœ½â„“subscriptâˆ‡ğœ½ğ‘”â‹…2â„“subscriptâˆ‡ğœ½â„“\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}g=2\ell\cdot\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\ellâˆ‡ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g = 2 roman_â„“ â‹… âˆ‡ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_â„“, and thus we have

â€–âˆ‡ğœ½gâ¢(ğœ½;Z)âˆ’âˆ‡ğœ½gâ¢(ğœ½â€²;Z)â€–2â‰¤2â¢Î²â¢maxâ¡{â„“â¢(ğœ½;Z),â„“â¢(ğœ½â€²;Z)}â¢â€–ğœ½âˆ’ğœ½â€²â€–2,subscriptnormsubscriptâˆ‡ğœ½ğ‘”ğœ½ğ‘subscriptâˆ‡ğœ½ğ‘”superscriptğœ½â€²ğ‘22ğ›½â„“ğœ½ğ‘â„“superscriptğœ½â€²ğ‘subscriptnormğœ½superscriptğœ½â€²2\displaystyle~{}\|\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}g(\boldsymbol{\theta};Z)-\nabla_% {\boldsymbol{\theta}}g(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime};Z)\|_{2}\leq 2\beta\max\{% \ell(\boldsymbol{\theta};Z),\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime};Z)\}\|% \boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|_{2},âˆ¥ âˆ‡ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; italic_Z ) - âˆ‡ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_Z ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ 2 italic_Î² roman_max { roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; italic_Z ) , roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_Z ) } âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (17)
â€–âˆ‡ğœ½gâ¢(ğœ½;Z)âˆ’âˆ‡ğœ½gâ¢(ğœ½;Zâ€²)â€–2â‰¤2â¢Î²â¢maxâ¡{â„“â¢(ğœ½;Z),â„“â¢(ğœ½;Zâ€²)}â¢â€–Zâˆ’Zâ€²â€–2,subscriptnormsubscriptâˆ‡ğœ½ğ‘”ğœ½ğ‘subscriptâˆ‡ğœ½ğ‘”ğœ½superscriptğ‘â€²22ğ›½â„“ğœ½ğ‘â„“ğœ½superscriptğ‘â€²subscriptnormğ‘superscriptğ‘â€²2\displaystyle~{}\|\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}g(\boldsymbol{\theta};Z)-\nabla_% {\boldsymbol{\theta}}g(\boldsymbol{\theta};Z^{\prime})\|_{2}\leq 2\beta\max\{% \ell(\boldsymbol{\theta};Z),\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta};Z^{\prime})\}\|Z-Z^{% \prime}\|_{2},âˆ¥ âˆ‡ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; italic_Z ) - âˆ‡ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; italic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ 2 italic_Î² roman_max { roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; italic_Z ) , roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; italic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) } âˆ¥ italic_Z - italic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,

which implies (2â¢Ïâ¢â„“Â¯+1)â¢Î²2ğœŒÂ¯â„“1ğ›½(2\rho\overline{\ell}+1)\beta( 2 italic_Ï overÂ¯ start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG + 1 ) italic_Î²-joint smoothness of â„’fairsubscriptâ„’fair\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in Eqn (7) and (8). âˆ

Lemma D.4.

For fair re-weighting mechanisms,

ğœ½(t+1)=argâ¡minğœ½â¡â„’fair=argâ¡minğœ½â¢âˆ‘sps(t)â¢(1+Ïâ¢â„’sâ¢(ğœ½(t));ğ’Ÿs(tâˆ’1))â¢â„’sâ¢(ğœ½);ğ’Ÿs(t),formulae-sequencesuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡1subscriptğœ½subscriptâ„’fairsubscriptğœ½subscriptğ‘ superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘ ğ‘¡1ğœŒsubscriptâ„’ğ‘ superscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğ’Ÿğ‘¡1ğ‘ subscriptâ„’ğ‘ ğœ½subscriptsuperscriptğ’Ÿğ‘¡ğ‘ \boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t+1)}=\arg\min_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\mathcal{L}_{\textsf% {fair}}=\arg\min_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\sum_{s}p_{s}^{(t)}(1+\rho\mathcal{L}_{s% }(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)});\mathcal{D}^{(t-1)}_{s})\mathcal{L}_{s}(% \boldsymbol{\theta});\mathcal{D}^{(t)}_{s},bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_Ï caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ) ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (18)

where âˆ‘sps(t)(1+Ïâ„’s(ğ›‰(t);ğ’Ÿs(tâˆ’1))â„’s(ğ›‰;ğ’Ÿs(t))\sum_{s}p_{s}^{(t)}(1+\rho\mathcal{L}_{s}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)};\mathcal{D% }^{(t-1)}_{s})\mathcal{L}_{s}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}^{(t)}_{s})âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_Ï caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strongly convex and (1+Ïâ¢â„“Â¯)1ğœŒÂ¯â„“(1+\rho\overline{\ell})( 1 + italic_Ï overÂ¯ start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG )-jointly smooth.

Proof.

At a high level, (1+Ïâ¢â„’sâ¢(ğœ½(t));ğ’Ÿs(tâˆ’1))1ğœŒsubscriptâ„’ğ‘ superscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğ’Ÿğ‘¡1ğ‘ (1+\rho\mathcal{L}_{s}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)});\mathcal{D}^{(t-1)}_{s})( 1 + italic_Ï caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) acts like a scalar that may scale the strong convexity and joint smoothness coefficient.

Since â„’s(ğœ½(t));ğ’Ÿs(tâˆ’1))â‰¥0\mathcal{L}_{s}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)});\mathcal{D}^{(t-1)}_{s})\geq 0caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¥ 0, we know the Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strong convexity part holds.

Similarly, since â„’s(ğœ½(t));ğ’Ÿs(tâˆ’1))â‰¤â„“Â¯\mathcal{L}_{s}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)});\mathcal{D}^{(t-1)}_{s})\leq% \overline{\ell}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ overÂ¯ start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG, we know the (1+Ïâ¢â„“Â¯)1ğœŒÂ¯â„“(1+\rho\overline{\ell})( 1 + italic_Ï overÂ¯ start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG )-joint smoothness holds. âˆ

This lemma shows that we can treat â„’sâ¢(ğœ½(t);ğ’Ÿs(tâˆ’1))â¢â„’sâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿs(t))subscriptâ„’ğ‘ superscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğ’Ÿğ‘¡1ğ‘ subscriptâ„’ğ‘ ğœ½subscriptsuperscriptğ’Ÿğ‘¡ğ‘ \mathcal{L}_{s}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)};\mathcal{D}^{(t-1)}_{s})\mathcal{L}_% {s}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}^{(t)}_{s})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) as the fair objective in fair er-weighting mechanisms, where this objective has very similar properties as the fair objectives using the fair penalty mechanism.

Based on the above lemmas, we present a result that bounds the fair-aware loss minimization solution distance from two different input distributions, where [4] and [5] derived similar bounds in the PP cases without fairness penalties.

Lemma D.5.

(Bounding the fair objective minimizers)

Given fair-aware loss function â„’fairsubscriptâ„’fair\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT that is Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³-strongly convex and Î²~~ğ›½\tilde{\beta}over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG-jointly smooth. Then for two distributions ğ’Ÿ,ğ’Ÿ~âˆˆâ–³â¢(ğ’µ)ğ’Ÿ~ğ’Ÿâ–³ğ’µ\mathcal{D},\tilde{\mathcal{D}}\in\triangle(\mathcal{Z})caligraphic_D , over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG âˆˆ â–³ ( caligraphic_Z ), denote

ğœ½fairâˆ—=Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ;â„’fair):=argâ¡minğœ½â¡â„’fairâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ),ğœ½~fairâˆ—=Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ~;â„’fair):=argâ¡minğœ½â¡â„’fairâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ~),formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptğœ½fairğºğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairassignsubscriptğœ½subscriptâ„’fairğœ½ğ’Ÿsuperscriptsubscript~ğœ½fairğº~ğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairassignsubscriptğœ½subscriptâ„’fairğœ½~ğ’Ÿ\boldsymbol{\theta}_{\textsf{fair}}^{*}=G(\mathcal{D};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{% fair}}):=\arg\min_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol% {\theta};\mathcal{D}),~{}~{}~{}\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{\textsf{fair}}^{*}% =G(\tilde{\mathcal{D}};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}):=\arg\min_{\boldsymbol{% \theta}}\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\tilde{\mathcal{D}}),bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_G ( caligraphic_D ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) := roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) , over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_G ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) := roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ) , (19)

we have

â€–ğœ½fairâˆ—âˆ’ğœ½~fairâˆ—â€–2â‰¤Î²~Î³â¢ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ,ğ’Ÿ~).subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscriptğœ½fairsuperscriptsubscript~ğœ½fair2~ğ›½ğ›¾subscriptğ’²1ğ’Ÿ~ğ’Ÿ\|\boldsymbol{\theta}_{\textsf{fair}}^{*}-\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{\textsf% {fair}}^{*}\|_{2}\leq\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},% \tilde{\mathcal{D}}).âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ end_ARG caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ) . (20)
Proof.

Using the strong convexity property and the fact that Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ;â„’fair)ğºğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairG(\mathcal{D};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})italic_G ( caligraphic_D ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is the unique minimizer of â„’fairâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ)subscriptâ„’fairğœ½ğ’Ÿ\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ), we can derive that

âˆ’Î³â¢â€–Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ;â„’fair)âˆ’Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ~;â„’fair)â€–22â‰¥(Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ;â„’fair)âˆ’Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ~;â„’fair))âŠ¤â¢âˆ‡ğœ½â„’fairâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ).ğ›¾superscriptsubscriptnormğºğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairğº~ğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fair22superscriptğºğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairğº~ğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairtopsubscriptâˆ‡ğœ½subscriptâ„’fairğœ½ğ’Ÿ-\gamma\|G(\mathcal{D};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})-G(\tilde{\mathcal{D}};% \mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})\|_{2}^{2}\geq(G(\mathcal{D};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{% fair}})-G(\tilde{\mathcal{D}};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}))^{\top}\nabla_{% \boldsymbol{\theta}}\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D% }).- italic_Î³ âˆ¥ italic_G ( caligraphic_D ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_G ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¥ ( italic_G ( caligraphic_D ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_G ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‡ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) . (21)

Then for Eqn (8), we observe that

(Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ;â„’fair)âˆ’Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ~;â„’fair))âŠ¤â¢âˆ‡ğœ½â„“â¢(ğœ½;Z)superscriptğºğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairğº~ğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairtopsubscriptâˆ‡ğœ½â„“ğœ½ğ‘(G(\mathcal{D};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})-G(\tilde{\mathcal{D}};\mathcal{L}_% {\textsf{fair}}))^{\top}\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta};Z)( italic_G ( caligraphic_D ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_G ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‡ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; italic_Z ) (22)

is â€–Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ;â„’fair)âˆ’Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ~;â„’fair)â€–2â¢Î²subscriptnormğºğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairğº~ğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fair2ğ›½\|G(\mathcal{D};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})-G(\tilde{\mathcal{D}};\mathcal{L}% _{\textsf{fair}})\|_{2}\betaâˆ¥ italic_G ( caligraphic_D ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_G ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î²-Lipschitz in Zğ‘Zitalic_Z, and

(Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ;â„’fair)âˆ’Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ~;â„’fair))âŠ¤â¢âˆ‡ğœ½â„“2â¢(ğœ½;Z)superscriptğºğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairğº~ğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairtopsubscriptâˆ‡ğœ½superscriptâ„“2ğœ½ğ‘(G(\mathcal{D};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})-G(\tilde{\mathcal{D}};\mathcal{L}_% {\textsf{fair}}))^{\top}\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\ell^{2}(\boldsymbol{% \theta};Z)( italic_G ( caligraphic_D ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_G ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‡ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_â„“ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; italic_Z ) (23)

is 2â¢â„“Â¯â¢â€–Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ;â„’fair)âˆ’Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ~;â„’fair)â€–2â¢Î²2Â¯â„“subscriptnormğºğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairğº~ğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fair2ğ›½2\overline{\ell}\|G(\mathcal{D};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})-G(\tilde{\mathcal% {D}};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})\|_{2}\beta2 overÂ¯ start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG âˆ¥ italic_G ( caligraphic_D ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_G ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î²-Lipschitz in Zğ‘Zitalic_Z, which follows from applying the Cauchy Schwartz inequality and the fact that â„“â„“\ellroman_â„“ is Î²ğ›½\betaitalic_Î²-jointly smooth.

Then we can derive that

(Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ;â„’fair)âˆ’Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ~;â„’fair))âŠ¤â¢âˆ‡ğœ½â„’fairâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ)â‰¥âˆ’(2â¢Ïâ¢â„“Â¯+1)â¢Î²â¢ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ,ğ’Ÿ~),superscriptğºğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairğº~ğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairtopsubscriptâˆ‡ğœ½subscriptâ„’fairğœ½ğ’Ÿ2ğœŒÂ¯â„“1ğ›½subscriptğ’²1ğ’Ÿ~ğ’Ÿ(G(\mathcal{D};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})-G(\tilde{\mathcal{D}};\mathcal{L}_% {\textsf{fair}}))^{\top}\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}% }(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D})\geq-(2\rho\overline{\ell}+1)\beta\mathcal{W% }_{1}(\mathcal{D},\tilde{\mathcal{D}}),( italic_G ( caligraphic_D ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_G ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‡ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) â‰¥ - ( 2 italic_Ï overÂ¯ start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG + 1 ) italic_Î² caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ) , (24)

and thus

âˆ’Î³â¢â€–Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ;â„’fair)âˆ’Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ~;â„’fair)â€–22â‰¥âˆ’(2â¢Ïâ¢â„“Â¯+1)â¢Î²â¢ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ,ğ’Ÿ~),ğ›¾superscriptsubscriptnormğºğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairğº~ğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fair222ğœŒÂ¯â„“1ğ›½subscriptğ’²1ğ’Ÿ~ğ’Ÿ-\gamma\|G(\mathcal{D};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})-G(\tilde{\mathcal{D}};% \mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})\|_{2}^{2}\geq-(2\rho\overline{\ell}+1)\beta% \mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},\tilde{\mathcal{D}}),- italic_Î³ âˆ¥ italic_G ( caligraphic_D ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_G ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¥ - ( 2 italic_Ï overÂ¯ start_ARG roman_â„“ end_ARG + 1 ) italic_Î² caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , over~ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG ) , (25)

we get the proof for Eqn (8), and we can similarly prove this for Eqn (7) and (9). âˆ

Lemma D.6.

(Bounding the fixed point distribution distance using parameter distance [5])

Suppose the transition mapping Tğ‘‡Titalic_T is Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilonitalic_Ïµ-jointly sensitive with Ïµâˆˆ(0,1)italic-Ïµ01\epsilon\in(0,1)italic_Ïµ âˆˆ ( 0 , 1 ), then for ğ›‰1,ğ›‰2subscriptğ›‰1subscriptğ›‰2\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1},\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2}bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and their corresponding fixed point distributions ğ’Ÿ1,ğ’Ÿ2subscriptğ’Ÿ1subscriptğ’Ÿ2\mathcal{D}_{1},\mathcal{D}_{2}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, it holds that

ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ1,ğ’Ÿ2)â‰¤Ïµ1âˆ’Ïµâ¢â€–ğœ½1âˆ’ğœ½2â€–2subscriptğ’²1subscriptğ’Ÿ1subscriptğ’Ÿ2italic-Ïµ1italic-Ïµsubscriptnormsubscriptğœ½1subscriptğœ½22\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D}_{1},\mathcal{D}_{2})\leq\frac{\epsilon}{1-\epsilon% }\|\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1}-\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2}\|_{2}caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_Ïµ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ïµ end_ARG âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (26)

Proposition 5.1. (Unique Fair-PS solution) Under Conditions in Lemma 2.4, if Ïµâ¢(1+Î²~/Î³)<1italic-Ïµ1~ğ›½ğ›¾1\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)<1italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) < 1, then for a given combination of (1) initial distribution ğ’Ÿ(0)superscriptğ’Ÿ0\mathcal{D}^{(0)}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and (2) fair mechanism with strength ÏğœŒ\rhoitalic_Ï, there is a unique Fair-PS solution.

Proof.

We define the fixed point transition mapping as

TFPâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ):=ğ’Ÿğœ½=TFPâ¢(ğœ½)assignsuperscriptTFPğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptğ’Ÿğœ½superscriptTFPğœ½\text{T}^{\text{FP}}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}):=\mathcal{D}_{% \boldsymbol{\theta}}=\text{T}^{\text{FP}}(\boldsymbol{\theta})T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT FP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) := caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT FP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ) (27)

the mapping returning the modelâ€™s fixed point distribution.

Then using the results in Lemma D.2, D.3, D.5, D.4, D.6, we can see that

ğœ½(t+1)=Gâ¢(TFPâ¢(ğœ½(t));â„’fair)superscriptğœ½ğ‘¡1ğºsuperscriptTFPsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptâ„’fair\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t+1)}=G(\text{T}^{\text{FP}}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)});% \mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_G ( T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT FP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (28)

is a contraction mapping when conditions in Lemma 2.4 hold since Ïµâ¢(1+Î²~/Î³)<1italic-Ïµ1~ğ›½ğ›¾1\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)<1italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) < 1. Therefore, using the Banach fixed-point theorem, we know that there is a unique Fair-PS pair. âˆ

D.2 Proof of Theorem 5.2

In this part, we provide the convergence of the class of Fair-RRM algorithms in Algorithm 1.

Lemma D.7.

([5]) Under conditions in Lemma 2.4, given a decision model with parameter ğ›‰ğ›‰\boldsymbol{\theta}bold_italic_Î¸, denote the parameter returned by Delayed Deployment Scheme as ğ’Ÿ^Î¸:=TDâ¢Lâ¢(ğ›‰;ğ’Ÿ)assignsubscript^ğ’ŸğœƒsuperscriptTğ·ğ¿ğ›‰ğ’Ÿ\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{\theta}:=\text{T}^{DL}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D})over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_D italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) and the fixed point distribution of ğ›‰ğ›‰\boldsymbol{\theta}bold_italic_Î¸ as ğ’Ÿğ›‰subscriptğ’Ÿğ›‰\mathcal{D}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then

ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ^ğœ½,ğ’Ÿğœ½)â‰¤Ïµ1âˆ’Ïµâ¢Î´subscriptğ’²1subscript^ğ’Ÿğœ½subscriptğ’Ÿğœ½italic-Ïµ1italic-Ïµğ›¿\mathcal{W}_{1}(\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}},\mathcal{D}_{% \boldsymbol{\theta}})\leq\frac{\epsilon}{1-\epsilon}\deltacaligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_Ïµ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ïµ end_ARG italic_Î´ (29)
Proof.
111Due to different notations, we present the proof in [5] to help the readers.

For a fixed ğœ½ğœ½\boldsymbol{\theta}bold_italic_Î¸ and Ïµ<1italic-Ïµ1\epsilon<1italic_Ïµ < 1, the map Tâ¢(ğœ½;â‹…)Tğœ½â‹…\text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\cdot)T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; â‹… ) is contracting with Lipschitz coefficient Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilonitalic_Ïµ and has a unique fixed point ğ’Ÿğœ½subscriptğ’Ÿğœ½\mathcal{D}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Note that ğ’Ÿ^ğœ½=TâŒˆrâŒ‰+1subscript^ğ’Ÿğœ½superscriptTğ‘Ÿ1\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}=\text{T}^{\lceil r\rceil+1}over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒˆ italic_r âŒ‰ + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, denote ğ’Ÿ1=Tâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ0)superscriptğ’Ÿ1ğ‘‡ğœ½superscriptğ’Ÿ0\mathcal{D}^{1}=T(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}^{0})caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), then

ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ^ğœ½,ğ’Ÿğœ½)â‰¤ÏµâŒˆrâŒ‰1âˆ’Ïµâ¢ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ0,ğ’Ÿ1),subscriptğ’²1subscript^ğ’Ÿğœ½subscriptğ’Ÿğœ½superscriptitalic-Ïµğ‘Ÿ1italic-Ïµsubscriptğ’²1superscriptğ’Ÿ0superscriptğ’Ÿ1\mathcal{W}_{1}(\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}},\mathcal{D}_{% \boldsymbol{\theta}})\leq\frac{\epsilon^{\lceil r\rceil}}{1-\epsilon}\mathcal{% W}_{1}(\mathcal{D}^{0},\mathcal{D}^{1}),caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_Ïµ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒˆ italic_r âŒ‰ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ïµ end_ARG caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , (30)

then since r=logâˆ’1â¡(1Ïµ)â¢logâ¡(ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ0,ğ’Ÿ1)Î´)ğ‘Ÿsuperscript11italic-Ïµsubscriptğ’²1superscriptğ’Ÿ0superscriptğ’Ÿ1ğ›¿r=\log^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{\epsilon}\right)\log\left(\frac{\mathcal{W}_{1}(% \mathcal{D}^{0},\mathcal{D}^{1})}{\delta}\right)italic_r = roman_log start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ïµ end_ARG ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG ), we have ÏµâŒˆrâŒ‰<Ïµr=Î´ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ0,ğ’Ÿ1)superscriptitalic-Ïµğ‘Ÿsuperscriptitalic-Ïµğ‘Ÿğ›¿subscriptğ’²1superscriptğ’Ÿ0superscriptğ’Ÿ1\epsilon^{\lceil r\rceil}<\epsilon^{r}=\frac{\delta}{\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{% D}^{0},\mathcal{D}^{1})}italic_Ïµ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒˆ italic_r âŒ‰ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_Ïµ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG, which completes the proof. âˆ

Theorem 5.2. (Fair-RRM Convergence) Under conditions in Lemma 2.4:

(i) If Ïµâ¢(1+Î²~/Î³)<1italic-Ïµ1~ğ›½ğ›¾1\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)<1italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) < 1, Algorithm 1 under the Conventional Schema converges to the Fair-PS pair at a linear rate.

(ii) If Ïµâ¢(1+Î²~/Î³)<1âˆ’Ïµitalic-Ïµ1~ğ›½ğ›¾1italic-Ïµ\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)<1-\epsilonitalic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) < 1 - italic_Ïµ, Algorithm 1 under the kğ‘˜kitalic_k-Delayed Schema converges to the Fair-PS pair at a linear rate for any kğ‘˜kitalic_k.

(iii) If Ïµâ¢(1+Î²~/Î³)<1italic-Ïµ1~ğ›½ğ›¾1\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)<1italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) < 1, Algorithm 1 under the Conventional Schema converges to a Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´ neighborhood of the Fair-PS pair in Oâ¢(log2â¡1Î´)ğ‘‚superscript21ğ›¿O(\log^{2}\frac{1}{\delta})italic_O ( roman_log start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG ) steps.

proof of (i).

We will define a distance metric

dpairâ¢((ğœ½1,ğ’Ÿ1),(ğœ½2,ğ’Ÿ2)):=ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ1,ğ’Ÿ2)+â€–ğœ½1âˆ’ğœ½2â€–2.assignsubscriptğ‘‘pairsubscriptğœ½1subscriptğ’Ÿ1subscriptğœ½2subscriptğ’Ÿ2subscriptğ’²1subscriptğ’Ÿ1subscriptğ’Ÿ2subscriptnormsubscriptğœ½1subscriptğœ½22d_{\text{pair}}((\boldsymbol{\theta}_{1},\mathcal{D}_{1}),(\boldsymbol{\theta}% _{2},\mathcal{D}_{2})):=\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D}_{1},\mathcal{D}_{2})+\|% \boldsymbol{\theta}_{1}-\boldsymbol{\theta}_{2}\|_{2}.italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT pair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) := caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (31)

Denote the Fair-RRM mapping as

Ffairâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ):=(Gfairâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ),Tâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ))assignsubscriptğ¹fairğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptğºfairğœ½ğ’ŸTğœ½ğ’ŸF_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}):=(G_{\textsf{fair}}(% \boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}),\text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}))italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) := ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) , T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) ) (32)

where Gfairâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ):=Gâ¢(Tâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ);â„’fair)assignsubscriptğºfairğœ½ğ’ŸğºTğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairG_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}):=G(\text{T}(\boldsymbol{% \theta};\mathcal{D});\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) := italic_G ( T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Then

dpairâ¢(Ffairâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ),Ffairâ¢(ğœ½â€²,ğ’Ÿâ€²))=ğ’²1â¢(Tâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ),Tâ¢(ğœ½â€²;ğ’Ÿâ€²))+â€–Gfairâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ)âˆ’Gfairâ¢(ğœ½â€²,ğ’Ÿâ€²)â€–2.subscriptğ‘‘pairsubscriptğ¹fairğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptğ¹fairsuperscriptğœ½â€²superscriptğ’Ÿâ€²subscriptğ’²1Tğœ½ğ’ŸTsuperscriptğœ½â€²superscriptğ’Ÿâ€²subscriptnormsubscriptğºfairğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptğºfairsuperscriptğœ½â€²superscriptğ’Ÿâ€²2d_{\text{pair}}(F_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}),F_{\textsf{% fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime},\mathcal{D}^{\prime}))=\mathcal{W}_{1}(% \text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}),\text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime% };\mathcal{D}^{\prime}))+\|G_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D})-% G_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime},\mathcal{D}^{\prime})\|_{2}.italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT pair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) , italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) = caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) , T ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) + âˆ¥ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) - italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (33)

The Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilonitalic_Ïµ-jointly sensitivity of the transition map T yields

ğ’²1â¢(Tâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ),Tâ¢(ğœ½â€²;ğ’Ÿâ€²))â‰¤Ïµâ¢ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ,ğ’Ÿâ€²)+Ïµâ¢â€–ğœ½âˆ’ğœ½â€²â€–2,subscriptğ’²1Tğœ½ğ’ŸTsuperscriptğœ½â€²superscriptğ’Ÿâ€²italic-Ïµsubscriptğ’²1ğ’Ÿsuperscriptğ’Ÿâ€²italic-Ïµsubscriptnormğœ½superscriptğœ½â€²2\mathcal{W}_{1}(\text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}),\text{T}(\boldsymbol% {\theta}^{\prime};\mathcal{D}^{\prime}))\leq\epsilon\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D% },\mathcal{D}^{\prime})+\epsilon\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{% \prime}\|_{2},caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) , T ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) â‰¤ italic_Ïµ caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_Ïµ âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (34)

and using Lemma D.5, we get

â€–Gfairâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ)âˆ’Gfairâ¢(ğœ½â€²,ğ’Ÿâ€²)â€–2â‰¤Î²~Î³â¢ğ’²1â¢(Tâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ),Tâ¢(ğœ½â€²;ğ’Ÿâ€²))â‰¤Ïµâ¢Î²~Î³â¢ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ,ğ’Ÿâ€²)+Ïµâ¢Î²~Î³â¢â€–ğœ½âˆ’ğœ½â€²â€–2.subscriptnormsubscriptğºfairğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptğºfairsuperscriptğœ½â€²superscriptğ’Ÿâ€²2~ğ›½ğ›¾subscriptğ’²1Tğœ½ğ’ŸTsuperscriptğœ½â€²superscriptğ’Ÿâ€²italic-Ïµ~ğ›½ğ›¾subscriptğ’²1ğ’Ÿsuperscriptğ’Ÿâ€²italic-Ïµ~ğ›½ğ›¾subscriptnormğœ½superscriptğœ½â€²2\|G_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D})-G_{\textsf{fair}}(% \boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime},\mathcal{D}^{\prime})\|_{2}\leq\frac{\tilde{\beta% }}{\gamma}\mathcal{W}_{1}(\text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}),\text{T}(% \boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime};\mathcal{D}^{\prime}))\leq\epsilon\frac{\tilde{% \beta}}{\gamma}\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},\mathcal{D}^{\prime})+\epsilon\frac% {\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|_{2}.âˆ¥ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) - italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ end_ARG caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) , T ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) â‰¤ italic_Ïµ divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ end_ARG caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_Ïµ divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ end_ARG âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (35)

Combining the above two equations, we get that under conditions in Lemma 2.4, the Fair-RRM mapping is a contraction mapping that has a unique fixed point, where the fixed point satisfies the criteria of being the PS solution.

The proof of this part referenced [5] Theorem 4. âˆ

proof of (ii).

Using the proof of contraction mapping in part (i), we complete the proof of part (ii). âˆ

proof of (iii).

Similar to the above, we denote the parameter returned by the Delayed Deployment Scheme as ğ’Ÿ^ğœ½=TDâ¢Lâ¢(ğœ½;â‹…)subscript^ğ’Ÿğœ½superscriptTğ·ğ¿ğœ½â‹…\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}=\text{T}^{DL}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\cdot)over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_D italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; â‹… ). We have ğœ½(t+1)=Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ^ğœ½(t);â„’fair)superscriptğœ½ğ‘¡1ğºsubscript^ğ’Ÿsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptâ„’fair\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t+1)}=G(\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}};% \mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_G ( over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

Recall that ğœ½fairPS=Gâ¢(ğ’ŸfairPS;â„’fair)subscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfairğºsubscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfairsubscriptâ„’fair\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}=G(\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{% \textsf{fair}};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_G ( caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Then Lemma D.5 indicates that

â€–ğœ½(t+1)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâ€–2=â€–Gâ¢(ğ’Ÿ^ğœ½(t);â„’fair)âˆ’Gâ¢(ğ’ŸfairPS;â„’fair)â€–2â‰¤Î²~Î³â‹…ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ^ğœ½(t),ğ’ŸfairPS).subscriptnormsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡1subscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfair2subscriptnormğºsubscript^ğ’Ÿsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptâ„’fairğºsubscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfairsubscriptâ„’fair2â‹…~ğ›½ğ›¾subscriptğ’²1subscript^ğ’Ÿsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfair\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t+1)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}% \|_{2}=\|G(\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{% fair}})-G(\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}};\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})% \|_{2}\leq\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\cdot\mathcal{W}_{1}(\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{% \boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}},\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}).âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ¥ italic_G ( over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_G ( caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ end_ARG â‹… caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (37)

Using the triangle inequality, we have

ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ^ğœ½,ğ’ŸfairPS)â‰¤ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ^ğœ½,ğ’Ÿğœ½(t))+ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿğœ½(t),ğ’ŸfairPS),subscriptğ’²1subscript^ğ’Ÿğœ½subscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfairsubscriptğ’²1subscript^ğ’Ÿğœ½subscriptğ’Ÿsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptğ’²1subscriptğ’Ÿsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfair\mathcal{W}_{1}(\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}},\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}% }_{\textsf{fair}})\leq\mathcal{W}_{1}(\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}},% \mathcal{D}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}})+\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D}_{% \boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}},\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}),caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (38)

where ğ’Ÿğœ½(t)subscriptğ’Ÿsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡\mathcal{D}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the fixed point distribution of ğœ½(t)superscriptğœ½ğ‘¡\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

We can use Lemma D.7 to get ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ^ğœ½,ğ’Ÿğœ½(t))â‰¤Ïµâ¢Î´1âˆ’Ïµsubscriptğ’²1subscript^ğ’Ÿğœ½subscriptğ’Ÿsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡italic-Ïµğ›¿1italic-Ïµ\mathcal{W}_{1}(\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}},\mathcal{D}_{% \boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}})\leq\frac{\epsilon\delta}{1-\epsilon}caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_Ïµ italic_Î´ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ïµ end_ARG and use Lemma D.6 and the sensitivity definition to get ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿğœ½(t),ğ’ŸfairPS)â‰¤Ïµ1âˆ’Ïµâ¢â€–ğœ½(t)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâ€–2subscriptğ’²1subscriptğ’Ÿsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfairitalic-Ïµ1italic-Ïµsubscriptnormsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfair2\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}},\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}% }_{\textsf{fair}})\leq\frac{\epsilon}{1-\epsilon}\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}-% \boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_{2}caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_Ïµ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ïµ end_ARG âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Therefore,

ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ^ğœ½,ğ’ŸfairPS)â‰¤Ïµ1âˆ’Ïµâ¢(Î´+â€–ğœ½(t)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâ€–2).subscriptğ’²1subscript^ğ’Ÿğœ½subscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfairitalic-Ïµ1italic-Ïµğ›¿subscriptnormsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfair2\mathcal{W}_{1}(\hat{\mathcal{D}}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}},\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}% }_{\textsf{fair}})\leq\frac{\epsilon}{1-\epsilon}(\delta+\|\boldsymbol{\theta}% ^{(t)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_{2}).caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_Ïµ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ïµ end_ARG ( italic_Î´ + âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (39)

When â€–ğœ½(t)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâ€–2>Î´subscriptnormsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfair2ğ›¿\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_% {2}>\deltaâˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_Î´, we have

â€–ğœ½(t+1)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâ€–2â¢<2â¢Ïµ1âˆ’Ïµâ¢Î²~Î³âˆ¥â¢ğœ½(t)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâˆ¥2â‰¤â€–ğœ½(t)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâ€–2.subscriptnormsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡1subscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfair2bra2italic-Ïµ1italic-Ïµ~ğ›½ğ›¾superscriptğœ½ğ‘¡evaluated-atsubscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfair2subscriptnormsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfair2\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t+1)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}% \|_{2}<\frac{2\epsilon}{1-\epsilon}\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\|\boldsymbol{% \theta}^{(t)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_{2}\leq\|% \boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_{2}.âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < divide start_ARG 2 italic_Ïµ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ïµ end_ARG divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ end_ARG âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (40)

On the other hand, when â€–ğœ½(t)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâ€–2â‰¤Î´subscriptnormsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfair2ğ›¿\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_% {2}\leq\deltaâˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_Î´, we have

â€–ğœ½(t+1)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâ€–2â‰¤2â¢Ïµ1âˆ’Ïµâ¢Î²~Î³â¢Î´â‰¤Î´subscriptnormsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡1subscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfair22italic-Ïµ1italic-Ïµ~ğ›½ğ›¾ğ›¿ğ›¿\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t+1)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}% \|_{2}\leq\frac{2\epsilon}{1-\epsilon}\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\delta\leq\deltaâˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ divide start_ARG 2 italic_Ïµ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ïµ end_ARG divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ end_ARG italic_Î´ â‰¤ italic_Î´ (41)

Combining the two cases together, we know that for tâ‰¥(1âˆ’2â¢Ïµâ¢Î²~Î³â¢(1âˆ’Ïµ))âˆ’1â¢logâ¡(ğœ½(0)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSÎ´)ğ‘¡superscript12italic-Ïµ~ğ›½ğ›¾1italic-Ïµ1superscriptğœ½0subscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfairğ›¿t\geq\left(1-\frac{2\epsilon\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma(1-\epsilon)}\right)^{-1}\log% \left(\frac{\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(0)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf% {fair}}}{\delta}\right)italic_t â‰¥ ( 1 - divide start_ARG 2 italic_Ïµ over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ ( 1 - italic_Ïµ ) end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log ( divide start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG ), we have

â€–ğœ½(t)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâ€–2â‰¤(2â¢Ïµ1âˆ’Ïµâ¢Î²~Î³)tâ¢Î´â‰¤Î´,subscriptnormsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘¡subscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfair2superscript2italic-Ïµ1italic-Ïµ~ğ›½ğ›¾ğ‘¡ğ›¿ğ›¿\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_% {2}\leq\left(\frac{2\epsilon}{1-\epsilon}\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\right)^{% t}\delta\leq\delta,âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ ( divide start_ARG 2 italic_Ïµ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ïµ end_ARG divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î´ â‰¤ italic_Î´ , (42)

which completes the proof for part (iii).

The proof of this part referenced [5] Theorem 8. âˆ

D.3 Proof of Theorem B.3

In this part, we provide the convergence of the class of fair-RERM algorithms in Algorithm 2.

Theorem B.3 (Fair RERM Convergence) Under conditions in Lemma 2.4, suppose âˆƒÎ±>1,Î¼>0formulae-sequenceğ›¼1ğœ‡0\exists\alpha>1,\mu>0âˆƒ italic_Î± > 1 , italic_Î¼ > 0 such that âˆ«â„meÎ¼â¢|x|Î±â¢Zâ¢ğ‘‘xsubscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘šsuperscriptğ‘’ğœ‡superscriptğ‘¥ğ›¼ğ‘differential-dğ‘¥\int_{\mathbb{R}^{m}}e^{\mu|x|^{\alpha}}Zdxâˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î¼ | italic_x | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Z italic_d italic_x is finite âˆ€Zâˆˆâ–³â¢(ğ’µ)for-allğ‘â–³ğ’µ\forall Z\in\triangle(\mathcal{Z})âˆ€ italic_Z âˆˆ â–³ ( caligraphic_Z ).

For given a convergence radius Î´âˆˆ(0,1)ğ›¿01\delta\in(0,1)italic_Î´ âˆˆ ( 0 , 1 ), take nt=Oâ¢(logâ¡(t/p)(Ïµâ¢(1+Î²~/Î³)â¢Î´)m)subscriptğ‘›ğ‘¡ğ‘‚ğ‘¡ğ‘superscriptitalic-Ïµ1~ğ›½ğ›¾ğ›¿ğ‘šn_{t}=O\left(\frac{\log(t/p)}{(\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)\delta)^{m}}\right)italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_O ( divide start_ARG roman_log ( italic_t / italic_p ) end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) italic_Î´ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) samples at tğ‘¡titalic_t. If 2â¢Ïµâ¢(1+Î²~/Î³)<12italic-Ïµ1~ğ›½ğ›¾12\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)<12 italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) < 1, then with probability 1âˆ’p1ğ‘1-p1 - italic_p, the iterates of fair-RERM are within a radius Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´ of the Fair-PS pair for tâ‰¥(1âˆ’2Ïµ(1+Î²~/Î³)O(log(1/Î´))t\geq(1-2\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)O(\log(1/\delta))italic_t â‰¥ ( 1 - 2 italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) italic_O ( roman_log ( 1 / italic_Î´ ) ).

Proof.

Given nğ‘›nitalic_n samples from ğ’Ÿğ’Ÿ\mathcal{D}caligraphic_D, denote ğ’Ÿ^nsuperscript^ğ’Ÿğ‘›\hat{\mathcal{D}}^{n}over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT the empirical distribution obtained from them. Denote

(recall Gfairâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ):=Gâ¢(Tâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ);â„’fair)assignsubscriptğºfairğœ½ğ’ŸğºTğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptâ„’fairG_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}):=G(\text{T}(\boldsymbol{% \theta};\mathcal{D});\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) := italic_G ( T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) in Eqn (32)). And also denote the Fair-RERM mapping as

By Theorem 2 of [42], since âˆƒÎ±>1,Î¼>0formulae-sequenceğ›¼1ğœ‡0\exists\alpha>1,\mu>0âˆƒ italic_Î± > 1 , italic_Î¼ > 0 such that âˆ«â„meÎ¼â¢|x|Î±â¢Zâ¢ğ‘‘xsubscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘šsuperscriptğ‘’ğœ‡superscriptğ‘¥ğ›¼ğ‘differential-dğ‘¥\int_{\mathbb{R}^{m}}e^{\mu|x|^{\alpha}}Zdxâˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î¼ | italic_x | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Z italic_d italic_x is finite âˆ€Zâˆˆâ–³â¢(ğ’µ)for-allğ‘â–³ğ’µ\forall Z\in\triangle(\mathcal{Z})âˆ€ italic_Z âˆˆ â–³ ( caligraphic_Z ), then if nt=ğ’ªâ¢(1Ïµâ¢(1+Î²~/Î³)mâ¢logâ¡(t/p))subscriptğ‘›ğ‘¡ğ’ª1italic-Ïµsuperscript1~ğ›½ğ›¾ğ‘šğ‘¡ğ‘n_{t}=\mathcal{O}\left(\frac{1}{\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)^{m}}\log(t/p)\right)italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_O ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log ( italic_t / italic_p ) ), where mğ‘šmitalic_m is the dimension of the sample, we have ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ,ğ’Ÿ^n)â‰¥Ïµâ¢(1+Î²~/Î³)â¢Î´subscriptğ’²1ğ’Ÿsuperscript^ğ’Ÿğ‘›italic-Ïµ1~ğ›½ğ›¾ğ›¿\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},\hat{\mathcal{D}}^{n})\geq\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}% /\gamma)\deltacaligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) â‰¥ italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) italic_Î´ with probability at most 6â¢pÏ€2â¢t26ğ‘superscriptğœ‹2superscriptğ‘¡2\frac{6p}{\pi^{2}t^{2}}divide start_ARG 6 italic_p end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG.

â„™(ğ’²1(ğ’Ÿ,ğ’Ÿ^n)â‰¤Ïµ(1+Î²~/Î³)Î´),âˆ€t)=1âˆ’âˆ‘t=1âˆâ„™(ğ’²1(ğ’Ÿ,ğ’Ÿ^nt)>Ïµ(1+Î²~/Î³)Î´)â‰¥1âˆ’âˆ‘t=1âˆ6â¢pÏ€2â¢t2=1âˆ’p\mathbb{P}\big{(}\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},\hat{\mathcal{D}}^{n})\leq% \epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)\delta\big{)},\forall t)=1-\sum_{t=1}^{\infty}% \mathbb{P}\big{(}\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},\hat{\mathcal{D}}^{n_{t}})>% \epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)\delta\big{)}\geq 1-\sum_{t=1}^{\infty}\frac{6% p}{\pi^{2}t^{2}}=1-pblackboard_P ( caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) â‰¤ italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) italic_Î´ ) , âˆ€ italic_t ) = 1 - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_P ( caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) > italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) italic_Î´ ) â‰¥ 1 - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 6 italic_p end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG = 1 - italic_p (45)

i.e., with probability at least 1âˆ’âˆ‘t=1âˆ1âˆ’p1superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡11ğ‘1-\sum_{t=1}^{\infty}1-p1 - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 - italic_p we have that for each time step tğ‘¡titalic_t, it holds that

ğ’²1â¢(ğ’Ÿ,ğ’Ÿ^n)â‰¤Ïµâ¢(1+Î²~/Î³)â¢Î´.subscriptğ’²1ğ’Ÿsuperscript^ğ’Ÿğ‘›italic-Ïµ1~ğ›½ğ›¾ğ›¿\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},\hat{\mathcal{D}}^{n})\leq\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}% /\gamma)\delta.caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) â‰¤ italic_Ïµ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG / italic_Î³ ) italic_Î´ . (46)

Then if dpairâ¢((ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ),(ğœ½fairPS,ğ’ŸfairPS))â‰¥Î´subscriptğ‘‘pairğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfairsubscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfairğ›¿d_{\text{pair}}\big{(}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}),(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{% \text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}},\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}})\big{)}\geq\deltaitalic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT pair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) , ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) â‰¥ italic_Î´, and Eqn (46) holds, we have

dpairâ¢(F^fairâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ),(ğœ½fairPS,ğ’ŸfairPS))subscriptğ‘‘pairsubscript^ğ¹fairğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfairsubscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfair\displaystyle~{}d_{\text{pair}}(\hat{F}_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},% \mathcal{D}),(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}},\mathcal{D}^{% \text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}))italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT pair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) , ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) )
=\displaystyle== ğ’²1â¢(Tâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ),ğ’ŸfairPS)+â€–G^fairnâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ)âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâ€–2subscriptğ’²1Tğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfairsubscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript^ğºğ‘›fairğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfair2\displaystyle~{}\mathcal{W}_{1}(\text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}),% \mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}})+\|\hat{G}^{n}_{\textsf{fair}}(% \boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D})-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair% }}\|_{2}caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_G end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
â‰¤\displaystyle\leqâ‰¤ ğ’²1â¢(Tâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ),Tâ¢(ğœ½fairPS;ğ’ŸfairPS))+â€–G^fairnâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ)âˆ’Gfairâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ)â€–2+â€–Gfairâ¢(ğœ½,ğ’Ÿ)âˆ’Gfairâ¢(ğœ½fairPS;ğ’ŸfairPS)â€–2subscriptğ’²1Tğœ½ğ’ŸTsubscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfairsubscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfairsubscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript^ğºğ‘›fairğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptğºfairğœ½ğ’Ÿ2subscriptnormsubscriptğºfairğœ½ğ’Ÿsubscriptğºfairsubscriptsuperscriptğœ½PSfairsubscriptsuperscriptğ’ŸPSfair2\displaystyle~{}\mathcal{W}_{1}(\text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}),% \text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}};\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS% }}_{\textsf{fair}}))+\|\hat{G}^{n}_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},% \mathcal{D})-G_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D})\|_{2}+\|G_{% \textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D})-G_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{% \theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}};\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}})\|% _{2}caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) , T ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) + âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_G end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) - italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + âˆ¥ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ , caligraphic_D ) - italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
â‰¤\displaystyle\leqâ‰¤ Ïµğ’²1(ğ’Ÿ,ğ’ŸfairPS)+Ïµâˆ¥ğœ½âˆ’ğœ½fairPSâˆ¥2+Î²~Î³ğ’²1(T^n(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ),T(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ))+Î²~Î³(T(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿ)),T(ğœ½fairPS;ğ’ŸfairPS)))\displaystyle~{}\epsilon\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{% \textsf{fair}})+\epsilon\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_% {\textsf{fair}}\|_{2}+\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\mathcal{W}_{1}(\hat{\text{T% }}^{n}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}),\text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{% D}))+\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}(\text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D})),% \text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}};\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS% }}_{\textsf{fair}})))italic_Ïµ caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Ïµ âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ end_ARG caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG T end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) , T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) ) + divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Î² end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ end_ARG ( T ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D ) ) , T ( bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) )

where the third line uses triangle inequality, fourth line uses Lemma D.5, and fifth line uses Eqn (46). In other words, the above shows that if the current pair is more than Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´ away from the Fair PS solution, then as long as Eqn (46) is true, the Fair RERM mapping is a contraction.

which means the pair will stay in the Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´ radius ball once an iterate goes in the ball.
