This completes the proof.

For the kğ‘˜kitalic_k-Delayed RERM, we can follow the proof of part (ii) in Theorem 5.2 that the transition TksuperscriptTğ‘˜\text{T}^{k}T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is Ïµ~:=Ïµ1âˆ’Ïµassign~italic-Ïµitalic-Ïµ1italic-Ïµ\tilde{\epsilon}:=\frac{\epsilon}{1-\epsilon}over~ start_ARG italic_Ïµ end_ARG := divide start_ARG italic_Ïµ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ïµ end_ARG jointly sensitive, and if we replace the Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilonitalic_Ïµ terms with Ïµ~~italic-Ïµ\tilde{\epsilon}over~ start_ARG italic_Ïµ end_ARG and times a kğ‘˜kitalic_k scalar in the number of iterations, we can get the similar result.

The proof of this part referenced Theorem 5 in [5] âˆ

D.4 Proof of the Fairness Guarantee

Discussion of the intricate nature of proving the effectiveness of ÏğœŒ\rhoitalic_Ï under the general PP setting. We first note that it is non-trivial to find out whether fairness at PS solution increases as ÏğœŒ\rhoitalic_Ï increases under the general setting where both the group fractions and the group-wise feature-label distributions change. Consider an example where the agents in the minority group are influenced by the majority group, i.e., when their group fraction becomes less than a threshold, their tastes are shaped by the mainstream culture. Then they can change their feature-label distributions to be more similar to the one of the majority group. This will possibly make the loss disparity smaller even when ÏğœŒ\rhoitalic_Ï becomes larger. However, in majority of previous work on the retention of recommendation system [2, 12], the group-wise distributions are assumed to be static.

Proof of Theorem 5.4. With Assumption 5.3, we state Lemma D.8.

Lemma D.8 (fairness guarantee at a single step).

At each single step, the following results hold:

(i) Given ğ’Ÿ(t)superscriptğ’Ÿğ‘¡\mathcal{D}^{(t)}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT fixed (i.e., pa(t),pb(t)superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¡p_{a}^{(t)},p_{b}^{(t)}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT stay fixed), increasing ÏğœŒ\rhoitalic_Ï in Eqn. (7) leads to lower or equal â–³fair,â„’tâ¢(Ï)subscriptsuperscriptâ–³ğ‘¡fairâ„’ğœŒ\triangle^{t}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho)â–³ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Ï ) ;

(ii) Given the optimization objective fixed (i.e., ÏğœŒ\rhoitalic_Ï stays fixed), lower fraction disparity â–³p(t)superscriptsubscriptâ–³ğ‘ğ‘¡\triangle_{p}^{(t)}â–³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT leads to lower or equal â–³fair,â„’tâ¢(Ï)subscriptsuperscriptâ–³ğ‘¡fairâ„’ğœŒ\triangle^{t}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho)â–³ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Ï ) when the minority group incurs higher loss.

Proof of (i).

We prove (i) by contradiction.

Assume Ï1<Ï2subscriptğœŒ1subscriptğœŒ2\rho_{1}<\rho_{2}italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and denote the the optimized model parameters as Î¸Ï1,Î¸Ï2subscriptğœƒsubscriptğœŒ1subscriptğœƒsubscriptğœŒ2\theta_{\rho_{1}},\theta_{\rho_{2}}italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Since ğ’Ÿssubscriptğ’Ÿğ‘ \mathcal{D}_{s}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT does not change over time, we can know the group-wise loss under Ï1,Ï2subscriptğœŒ1subscriptğœŒ2\rho_{1},\rho_{2}italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at both rounds Ls,Ï1t=Ls,Ï1tâˆ’1=Ls,Ï1superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡1subscriptğ¿ğ‘ subscriptğœŒ1L_{s,\rho_{1}}^{t}=L_{s,\rho_{1}}^{t-1}=L_{s,\rho_{1}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT Ls,Ï2t=Ls,Ï2tâˆ’1=Ls,Ï2superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡1subscriptğ¿ğ‘ subscriptğœŒ2L_{s,\rho_{2}}^{t}=L_{s,\rho_{2}}^{t-1}=L_{s,\rho_{2}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Thus, we can interchange the superscript arbitrarily (i.e., if the deployed models are the same, Lst=Lstâˆ’1superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ ğ‘¡1L_{s}^{t}=L_{s}^{t-1}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT). Wlog, assume La,Ï1t>Lb,Ï1tsuperscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}>L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then consider all possible scenarios where the loss disparity may be larger:

  • â€¢

    La,Ï1t<La,Ï2tsuperscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}<L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï     â‡”â‡”\displaystyle\Leftrightarrow~{}â‡” paâ‹…(La,Ï2t+La,Ï1t)â‹…(La,Ï2tâˆ’La,Ï1t)+pbâ‹…(Lb,Ï2t+Lb,Ï1t)â‹…(Lb,Ï2tâˆ’Lb,Ï1t)<0â‹…subscriptğ‘ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡â‹…subscriptğ‘ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡0\displaystyle p_{a}\cdot\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}+L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)% \cdot\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)+p_{b}\cdot\left(L_{b,% \rho_{2}}^{t}+L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)\cdot\left(L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{b,\rho% _{1}}^{t}\right)<0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) â‹… ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT -     From Eqn. (52) and Eqn. (51), we can immediately get:

    paâ‹…(La,Ï2tâˆ’La,Ï1t)+pbâ‹…(Lb,Ï2tâˆ’Lb,Ï1t)>0â‹…subscriptğ‘ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡â‹…subscriptğ‘ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡0p_{a}\cdot\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)+p_{b}\cdot\left(L% _{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)>0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) > 0 (53)

    Otherwise Eqn. (51) would be smaller than 00. We have by assumption La,Ï2t>La,Ï1t>Lb,Ï1t>Lb,Ï2tsuperscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}>L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}>L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}>L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then La,Ï1t+La,Ï2t>Lb,Ï1t+Lb,Ï2tsuperscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}+L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}>L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}+L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Next, noticing that Lb,Ï2tâˆ’Lb,Ï1t<0superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡0L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}<0italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < 0 and La,Ï2tâˆ’La,Ï1t>0superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡0L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}>0italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0, then if we divide La,Ï1t+La,Ï2tsuperscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}+L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT at both sides of Eqn. (52), then we will get:

    paâ‹…(La,Ï2tâˆ’La,Ï1t)+pbâ‹…(Lb,Ï2t+Lb,Ï1t)(La,Ï2t+La,Ï1t)â‹…(Lb,Ï2tâˆ’Lb,Ï1t)<0â‹…subscriptğ‘ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡â‹…subscriptğ‘ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘subscriptğœŒ1ğ‘¡0p_{a}\cdot\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)+p_{b}\cdot\frac{% \left(L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}+L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)}{\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}+L% _{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)}\cdot\left(L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}% \right)<0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… divide start_ARG ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG â‹… ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) < 0 (54)

    However, the LHS of Eqn. (54) is larger than the LHS of Eqn. (53), while the LHS requires the opposite, producing a contradiction. Finally, note that it is impossible to let loss of one group stays fixed while the other one changes where we can easily prove with similar contradictions.

Since all the above scenarios do not hold, we have proved (i). Moreover, if for any Ï2>Ï1subscriptğœŒ2subscriptğœŒ1\rho_{2}>\rho_{1}italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the loss disparities are equal, it means that both groups achieve minimal loss with a same Î¸âˆ—superscriptğœƒ\theta^{*}italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which is very uncommon considering the difference of demographic groups. Thus, increasing ÏğœŒ\rhoitalic_Ï commonly leads to lower loss disparity Î”â„’(t)superscriptsubscriptÎ”â„’ğ‘¡\Delta_{\mathcal{L}}^{(t)}roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. âˆ

proof of (ii).

Next, we prove (ii) similarly. Denote the optimized group-wise loss under the two group fractions as Ls(t)superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ ğ‘¡L_{s}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Lsâ€²(t)superscriptsubscriptğ¿superscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘¡L_{s^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. To prove by contradiction, we need to consider the situations where the group fraction discrepancy becomes smaller.   • â€¢

    La(t)<Laâ€²(t)superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘¡L_{a}^{(t)}<L_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Lb(t)<Lbâ€²(t)superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘¡L_{b}^{(t)}<L_{b^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT: Eqn.     La(t)>Laâ€²(t)superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘¡L_{a}^{(t)}>L_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Lb(t)>Lbâ€²(t)superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘¡L_{b}^{(t)}>L_{b^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT: Eqn.     (pa(t)âˆ’paâ€²(t))â‹…(Laâ€²(t)âˆ’La(t))+(pb(t)âˆ’pbâ€²(t))â‹…(Lbâ€²(t)âˆ’Lb(t))>0â‹…superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ğ‘¡â‹…superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ğ‘¡0\left(p_{a}^{(t)}-p_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}\right)\cdot\left(L_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}-L% _{a}^{(t)}\right)+\left(p_{b}^{(t)}-p_{b^{\prime}}^{(t)}\right)\cdot\left(L_{b% ^{\prime}}^{(t)}-L_{b}^{(t)}\right)>0( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) â‹… ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) â‹… ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) > 0 (57)

    Noticing that pa(t)âˆ’paâ€²(t)=âˆ’(pb(t)âˆ’pbâ€²(t))superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘¡p_{a}^{(t)}-p_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}=-\left(p_{b}^{(t)}-p_{b^{\prime}}^{(t)}\right)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = - ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), then only when pa(t)âˆ’paâ€²(t)>0superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘superscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘¡0p_{a}^{(t)}-p_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}>0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0 we can make the above inequality holds. According to the situations where the group fraction discrepancy becomes smaller, we know pa(t)>pb(t)superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¡p_{a}^{(t)}>p_{b}^{(t)}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT must hold and ağ‘aitalic_a is the majority group. However, this contradicts the initial condition La(t)>Lb(t)superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘ğ‘¡L_{a}^{(t)}>L_{b}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, i.e, the majority group should not have higher group-wise loss.

Finally, it is easy to see the cases where losses stay fixed cannot satisfy Eqn. (55) and Eqn. (56) simultaneously. Thus, we prove (ii). âˆ

With Lemma D.8, we can easily prove Thm. 5.4. What we need to prove is â–³fair,â„’PSâ¢(Ï1)â‰¥â–³fair,â„’PSâ¢(Ï2)subscriptsuperscriptâ–³PSfairâ„’subscriptğœŒ1subscriptsuperscriptâ–³PSfairâ„’subscriptğœŒ2\triangle^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho_{1})\geq\triangle^{% \text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho_{2})â–³ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¥ â–³ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Ï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Now we know at tğ‘¡titalic_t, higher ÏğœŒ\rhoitalic_Ï results in lower or equal â–³fair,â„’tâ¢(Ï)subscriptsuperscriptâ–³ğ‘¡fairâ„’ğœŒ\triangle^{t}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho)â–³ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Ï ) ((i) of Lemma D.8). Then the lower or equal â–³fair,â„’tâ¢(Ï)subscriptsuperscriptâ–³ğ‘¡fairâ„’ğœŒ\triangle^{t}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho)â–³ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Ï ) results in lower group fraction disparity at t+1ğ‘¡1t+1italic_t + 1 (Assumption 5.3), and further causes lower loss disparity at t+1ğ‘¡1t+1italic_t + 1 ((ii) of Lemma D.8). This enables a forward induction to prove that â–³fair,â„’tâ¢(Ï)subscriptsuperscriptâ–³ğ‘¡fairâ„’ğœŒ\triangle^{t}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho)â–³ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Ï ) is non-decreasing with ÏğœŒ\rhoitalic_Ï at each time step to infinity, which completes the whole proof of Thm. 5.4.

D.5 Discussion on Performative Optimal (PO) Solutions

The PO solution is defined as

ğœ½PO:=ğ”¼Zâˆ¼ğ’Ÿğœ½â¢â„“â¢(ğœ½;Z),assignsuperscriptğœ½POsubscriptğ”¼similar-toğ‘subscriptğ’Ÿğœ½â„“ğœ½ğ‘\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PO}}:=\mathbb{E}_{Z\sim\mathcal{D}_{\boldsymbol{% \theta}}}\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta};Z),bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PO end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT := blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Z âˆ¼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_â„“ ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; italic_Z ) , (58)

ğ’Ÿğœ½subscriptğ’Ÿğœ½\mathcal{D}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the fixed point distribution.

At a high level, the PO solution and the approximation between PS and PO solution largely follows the analysis in [4, 5], where Theorem 6 in [5] states that if conditions in Lemma 2.4 and â„“â¢(â‹…;â‹…)â„“â‹…â‹…\ell(\cdot;\cdot)roman_â„“ ( â‹… ; â‹… ) is Lzsubscriptğ¿ğ‘§L_{z}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz in the second argument, then the PS and Po solution satisfies

â€–ğœ½POâˆ’ğœ½PSâ€–2â‰¤2â¢Lzâ¢ÏµÎ³â¢(1âˆ’Ïµ).subscriptnormsuperscriptğœ½POsuperscriptğœ½PS22subscriptğ¿ğ‘§italic-Ïµğ›¾1italic-Ïµ\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PO}}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}\|_{2}\leq% \frac{2L_{z}\epsilon}{\gamma(1-\epsilon)}.âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PO end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ divide start_ARG 2 italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïµ end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ ( 1 - italic_Ïµ ) end_ARG .

ğœ½fairPO:=argâ¡minğœ½â¡â„’fairâ¢(ğœ½;ğ’Ÿğœ½)assignsubscriptsuperscriptğœ½POfairsubscriptğœ½subscriptâ„’fairğœ½subscriptğ’Ÿğœ½\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PO}}_{\textsf{fair}}:=\arg\min_{\boldsymbol{\theta}% }\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}_{\boldsymbol{% \theta}})bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PO end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_Î¸ ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

But as we show previously, the fairness metrics are only stable and meaningful in PP when measured at the PS and Fair-PS solutions, so there isnâ€™t much practical value in finding the FPO solution.
